My values

April 18, 2018

Is pretty common to see companies list their core values. But you rarely see individuals doing that. I think it’s even more important. You need to know what are your values in order to clarify where you want to go. Those are mine, the order is also important.

  • Knowledge
  • Honesty
  • Efficiency
  • Impact
  • Mindfulness

Knowledge

This is probably the higher on my list. More than learning I value knowledge. There’s nothing in this life more noble than being educated. Than discovering the universe.

Honesty

Being truth to oneself and to others. There’s no better way to build durable and happy relationships.

Impact

It matters much more when you use the knowledge you have in order to improve the world in some way. This is also pretty important for me.

Efficiency

Part of what makes me a good programmer is that I simply hate doing things in a repetitive way. I tend to automate everything. If there’s anything in my path that means more work, I’ll remove it first.

Mindfulness

All these goals are a big “burden” to carry and it’s easy to feel overwhelmed. Mindfulness is the one that enables one to keep sanity on this road.

That’s it. I would like to know the values of people around me. So don’t hesitate sharing yours.
